channel.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
channel.description:
Well I made an alarm clock today, not my first clock so it didn't take to long since I knew how to do it pretty much but I wanted to make another and make it look more nice and thats where this one comes in, I know its basic but I learned from this as every C4D model I have made.
[img]http://img466.imageshack.us/img466/8695/clock5jq8.png[/img]
[img]http://img231.imageshack.us/img231/9986/clock6bu4.png[/img]
Finished image:
[img]http://img216.imageshack.us/img216/5703/clock8qq4.png[/img]

item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:19, topic:147514”]Bettterr =]

Actually, is that only standing on two legs O_o[/quote]

Yup mine stands on two legs(barley) but I based this clock off mine.

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:15, topic:147514”]I recommend getting a product, by MAXON, called BodyPaint3D.

Wouldn’t it be great if you could have all your favorite image editing tools directly in a single 3D environment? Wouldn’t it be great if they worked in conjunction with your 3D application rather than against it? Well, that’s exactly what BodyPaint 3D does!

It comes in handy, and it’s very easy to start using. You can use it with Maya and 3DS aswell, I believe. [/quote]
I may get it some time in the future, looks really cool.

I finished modeling the face of the clock.


I still have to edit the textures a little.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I recommend getting a product, by MAXON, called BodyPaint3D.

Wouldn't it be great if you could have all your favorite image editing tools directly in a single 3D environment? Wouldn't it be great if they worked in conjunction with your 3D application rather than against it? Well, that's exactly what BodyPaint 3D does!

It comes in handy, and it’s very easy to start using. You can use it with Maya and 3DS aswell, I believe.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:10, topic:147514”]I wish I understood what he said.

Archer, a way to make this better would to be, take off the textured hands of the clock, and add them separately. Maybe using different textures on different things, like, on yours everything is the same. I couldn’t tell if it was all attached or not when I first looked at it. Also, if you noticed from the picture I posted, the face of the clock dips-in, it doesn’t round-out like the way you designed it. It has a glass cover over the face as well(or at least I think it does).[/quote]

Actually I just took the whole clocks face off and am modeling it all, just about done to, got numbers and hands done but Now I am going to make the glass cover.

Read full topic

item.description:
@killerman93 wrote:

Its a bit too long

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:10, topic:147514”]I wish I understood what he said.

Archer, a way to make this better would to be, take off the textured hands of the clock, and add them separately. Maybe using different textures on different things, like, on yours everything is the same. I couldn’t tell if it was all attached or not when I first looked at it. Also, if you noticed from the picture I posted, the face of the clock dips-in, it doesn’t round-out like the way you designed it. It has a glass cover over the face as well(or at least I think it does).[/quote]

On my old alarm clock its all the same gold rusted color but i guess ill make it have some different textures and I don’t think your clock image has glass over it but ill add it to make it look better.[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:11, topic:147514”]Archer, I think you’re putting your light source way too close to the object. Try putting it a bit further away with less intensity.[/quote]
alright ill try that.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Archer, I think you’re putting your light source way too close to the object. Try putting it a bit further away with less intensity.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

I wish I understood what he said.

Archer, a way to make this better would to be, take off the textured hands of the clock, and add them separately. Maybe using different textures on different things, like, on yours everything is the same. I couldn’t tell if it was all attached or not when I first looked at it. Also, if you noticed from the picture I posted, the face of the clock dips-in, it doesn’t round-out like the way you designed it. It has a glass cover over the face as well(or at least I think it does).

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

So I see you took some suggestions of mine. Good job.

Nothing breath taking, but I’m really glad you’re getting better.

And I love how people talk about the little things that they like, because making those things happen is only a matter of checking a tic box lmao.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Schizzo:

I’m no graphics guru but that’s looks pretty good. The reflection and shadow are nice effects. Good job.

Thanks, the shadow is pretty much a must for a reality model and reflection isn’t but I like it so I use it just about all the time.

Read full topic

item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Because my alarm clock I based this off of is wide, its over 7 years old so back then they were some what big.

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Why is it oh-so-wide?

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Yea, some of the changed I made you can’t see, like the first clock I used way to much booleans so this time I just used 1 boolean, and for the bells I just cut a sphere in half, deleted bottom layer and extruded where as last time i used 2 spheres and a boolean, used bevels on the clock and the bottom of the clocks feet and a spline for the handle but yea I was a little disappointed on how primitive it was.

Read full topic

item.description:

Its basically just cylinders and 2 circles…
